page.title: 01Talnotry Glen
page.content: A pass through the hills taken by A712 road. Dominated on South East by Craignelder 601 metres high. In a highly afforested area and used by Forestry Commission to provide recreational amenities e.g. caravan site, picnic area, deer and feral goat parks, forest nature trail, angling loch and burn. A prominent feature is Murray's Monument, a stone obelisk, erected 1835, to comemorate the district's most famous son Alexander Murray, a shepherd's son who became Professor of Oriental Languages at Edinburgh University.
